hanzi-su-wiki:
誌

Значения

Запись, описание, журнал

Мнемоника

Запись как желание 志 сохранить речь 言 на письме. Позднее — описание, журнал.

Варианты

志

(Simplified: 志)
Pictophonetic: 志 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 志願 [ zhì yuàn ]: aspiration; ambition; to volunteer
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right

    • 志 [ zhì ] determination, will; mark, sign; to record, to write
heisig_chinese_memo: Annals are documents, or words, describing what happened in the past year.  You can use these words to help you to develop aspirations for next year.
heisig_constituent: document, say, words, keitai, mouth, intention, samurai, heart
koohiiStory1: A will is an important document that contains your final word on how you intend to distribute your assets.
koohiiStory2: This is quite simple: a document is a set of words describing your intentions.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: To say what's in a samurai's heart you start a magazine. You go around writing about and interviewing all the samurai so you can share what they say to everyone who wants to read!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Why hadn't anyone thought of making a samurai magazine before?!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately, your magazine helps the sheep (し) samurai find other samurai... and kill them. None of the samurai want to share their feelings with your magazine anymore, oh no!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The sheep samurai is ruining your magazine! Maybe you should start a new magazine called, "All the places the sheep samurai will be, so stay away!" to make up for all the damage you've caused.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 詞 (シ часть речи, слово), 詩 (うた、シ стихи).
Ru_trainchinese: zhì: (графема) знак, отметка; запись; хранить в памяти
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your intention (志) is to put the words (言) in the document
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Annals are documents, or words, describing what happened in the past year.  You can use these words to help you to develop aspirations for next year.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " word ", " Chi " sound. The original meaning is record. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Zhi, remember the aspirations. From the words, the aspirations sound." Such as "Liezi. "Yang Zhu": "The things of the immemorial era are eliminated, who is the aspiration?" Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Peach Blossom Spring": "After you get out, you can get the boat, then you will help you to the road, and aspiration everywhere."

The extension of "志" means a mark or mark. Such as "Southern Qi Book. "Han Xi Bo Chuan": "Fangyang native custom, neighbors planted mulberry trees in the world as the ambition, the boss used mulberry branches to hinder other places, and moved a few feet above the border, and the neighbors invaded it repeatedly. It also means to make a mark. Such as "New Tang Book. "The Story of Huang Chao": "Choose five thousand sharp pawns at all times, and kill the thief at night."

" Zhi " means an article or book that is a note. "Zhengzitong. "Yan Bu": "Zhi, all historical biographical articles and called Zhi." Such as "Selected Works. Xie Huilian "Inscriptions to the Ancient Tomb": "The inscription is annihilated, and the surname is not passed down." Yan Zhenqing of the Tang Dynasty "The tombstone of Yuan Jun, the former governor of Rongzhou and the governor of the Imperial History of the Central Government of the Tang Dynasty": "Yang Yanchang, the master of Zhongshushe Dagons are all made inscriptions to express the ambitions of the emperor." Another example is local chronicles and county chronicles.

" Zhi " can be linked to " mole ". Such as "Southern Qi Book. "Jiang Er Biography": "There are red ambitions on Gao Zongxun's scapula, and often secrets are not passed on. Er persuades the emperor to show it to others." "Song History. "The Five Elements": "In July, Zhang Zhong, a citizen of Leiyang County, gave birth to three boys from his wife, who had a white chi and a square inch, and was born with white hair."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " word ", " Chi " sound. The original meaning is record.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「志」聲。本義是記錄。《說文新附》：「誌，記誌也。从言，志聲。」如《列子．楊朱》：「太古之事滅矣，孰誌之哉？」東晉陶淵明〈桃花源記〉：「既出，得其船，便扶向路，處處誌之。」

　　「誌」引申表示記號、標記。如《南齊書．韓係伯傳》：「襄陽土俗，鄰居種桑樹於界上為誌，係伯以桑枝蔭妨他地，遷界上開數尺，鄰畔隨復侵之，係伯輒更改種。」又表示做記號。如《新唐書．黃巢傳》：「處存選銳卒五千以白𩫹自誌，夜入殺賊。」

　　「誌」表示記事的文章或書籍。《正字通．言部》：「誌，凡史傳記事之文並稱誌。」如《文選．謝惠連〈祭古冢文〉》：「銘誌湮滅，姓字不傳。」唐代顏真卿〈唐故容州都督兼御史中丞本管經略使元君表墓碑銘〉：「中書舍人楊炎常袞皆作碑誌，以抒君之志業。」又如地方誌、縣誌等。

　　「誌」可通「痣」。如《南齊書．江祏傳》：「高宗胛上有赤誌，常祕不傳，祏勸帝出以示人。」《宋史．五行志》：「七月，耒陽縣民張中妻產三男，其額有白誌方寸餘，上生白髮。 」

誌誌RS write down, record, magazine
  • words 言 from the mind of the master 志 written down
(Simplified: 志)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 志 indicates the sound; 言 (speech) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 言 [ yán ] words, speech; to speak, to say
    • 志 [ zhì ] determination, will; mark, sign; to record, to write
①意向：志願。志氣。志趣(志向和興趣)。志士(有堅決意志和高尚節操的人)。志學。
②記，記在心裏：誌喜。誌哀。永誌不忘。
③記號：標誌。
④記載的文字：雜誌。志怪(記載怪異的事)。
⑤稱輕重，量長短、多少：志子。用碗志志。
⑥姓氏。

雑誌(ざっし): journal, magazine

從「 言 」，「 志 」聲。本義是記錄。《說文新附》：「誌，記誌也。从言，志聲。」如《列子．楊朱》：「太古之事滅矣，孰誌之哉？」東晉陶淵明〈桃花源記〉：「既出，得其船，便扶向路，處處誌之。」 「 誌 」引申表示記號、標記。如《南齊書．韓係伯傳》：「襄陽土俗，鄰居種桑樹於界上為誌，係伯以桑枝蔭妨他地，遷界上開數尺，鄰畔隨復侵之，係伯輒更改種。」又表示做記號。如《新唐書．黃巢傳》：「處存選銳卒五千以白𩫹自誌，夜入殺賊。」 「 誌 」表示記事的文章或書籍。《正字通．言部》：「誌，凡史傳記事之文並稱誌。」如《文選．謝惠連〈祭古冢文〉》：「銘誌湮滅，姓字不傳。」唐代顏真卿〈唐故容州都督兼御史中丞本管經略使元君表墓碑銘〉：「中書舍人楊炎常袞皆作碑誌，以抒君之志業。」又如地方誌、縣誌等。 「 誌 」可通「 痣 」。如《南齊書．江祏傳》：「高宗胛上有赤誌，常祕不傳，祏勸帝出以示人。」《宋史．五行志》：「七月，耒陽縣民張中妻產三男，其額有白誌方寸餘，上生白髮。 」
From the " word", " Chi" sound. The original meaning is record. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Zhi, remember the aspirations. From the words, the aspirations sound." Such as "Liezi. "Yang Zhu": "The things of the immemorial era are eliminated, who is the aspiration?" Tao Yuanming of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Peach Blossom Spring": "After you get out, you can get the boat, then you will help you to the road, and aspiration everywhere." The extension of " 志" means a mark or mark. Such as "Southern Qi Book. "Han Xi Bo Chuan": "Fangyang native custom, neighbors planted mulberry trees in the world as the ambition, the boss used mulberry branches to hinder other places, and moved a few feet above the border, and the neighbors invaded it repeatedly. It also means to make a mark. Such as "New Tang Book. "The Story of Huang Chao": "Choose five thousand sharp pawns at all times, and kill the thief at night." " Zhi" means an article or book that is a note. "Zhengzitong. "Yan Bu": "Zhi, all historical biographical articles and called Zhi." Such as "Selected Works. Xie Huilian "Inscriptions to the Ancient Tomb": "The inscription is annihilated, and the surname is not passed down." Yan Zhenqing of the Tang Dynasty "The tombstone of Yuan Jun, the former governor of Rongzhou and the governor of the Imperial History of the Central Government of the Tang Dynasty": "Yang Yanchang, the master of Zhongshushe Dagons are all made inscriptions to express the ambitions of the emperor." Another example is local chronicles and county chronicles. " Zhi" can be linked to " mole". Such as "Southern Qi Book. "Jiang Er Biography": "There are red ambitions on Gao Zongxun's scapula, and often secrets are not passed on. Er persuades the emperor to show it to others." "Song History. "The Five Elements": "In July, Zhang Zhong, a citizen of Leiyang County, gave birth to three boys from his wife, who had a white chi and a square inch, and was born with white hair."

誌字的基本解释

誌
zhì
同“志”②誌④。

誌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhì］
［《廣韻》職吏切，去志，章。］
(1)记录。
(2)记忆。
(3)记号；标记。
(4)做记号。
(5)记事的书籍或文章。
(6)称期刊杂志。
(7)识认。
(8)通“痣”。黡子。

誌字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　誌； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1161第17
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?職吏切，音志。【說文】記誌也。【唐書·褚亮傳】圖史一經目，輒誌于心。【南齊書·王慈傳】朝堂榜誌。【列子·楊朱篇】大古之事滅矣，孰誌之哉。【文中子·述史篇】制誌詔?，則幾乎典誥矣。【註】誌，臣下誌君之善也。　又【正韻】支義切，音寘。義同。　又同志。【正字通】凡史傳記事之文曰誌。【周禮·春官】小史掌邦國之志。【註】志，謂記也。又【漢書】有十志，俱與誌同。　又【類篇】或作識。【論語】女以予爲多學而識之者與。　又【韻會】通作痣。【史記·漢高祖紀】左股七十二黑子。【師古註】今中國通呼爲黶子，吳楚俗謂之誌。誌，記也。【南齊書·江祏傳】高宗胛上有赤誌。

考證：〔【論語】汝以予爲多學而識之者與。〕　謹照原文汝改女。
誌字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
誌字的起名意思

记，记住；记述，又指记事物的书或文章；记号，标记。

Name meaning
To remember, to remember; To describe, also refers to a book or article that remembers things; marks, marks.
zhì
вм. 志
Radicals: 言, 士, 心  (say, samurai, heart)
Meaning Mnemonic
To say what's in a samurai's heart you start a magazine. You go around writing about and interviewing all the samurai so you can share what they say to everyone who wants to read!
Why hadn't anyone thought of making a samurai magazine before?!
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately, your magazine helps the sheep (し) samurai find other samurai... and kill them. None of the samurai want to share their feelings with your magazine anymore, oh no!
The sheep samurai is ruining your magazine! Maybe you should start a new magazine called, "All the places the sheep samurai will be, so stay away!" to make up for all the damage you've caused.
